+072: def line_parameters(list lines, double lane_width, double main_angle, double main_angle_distance, double angle_tolerance):
/* Python wrapper */

static char __pyx_doc_15trajectorybuild_2line_parameters[] = "Compute the parameters given to the fuzzy systems from the discrete curves\n\t   - lines               : list<ndarray[2, N]> : Input discrete curves, in metric coordinates in the local road frame\n\t   - lane_width          : double              : Expected lane width, in meters\n\t   - main_angle          : double              : Expected angle of the lane relative to the vehicle, in radians\n\t   - main_angle_distance : double              : Distance at which that angle is reached\n\t   - angle_tolerance     : double              : Tolerance in radians around the main_angle for the initial point of each curve\n\t<------------------------- ndarray[M]          : Distance of the initial point of each curve to the vehicle\n\t<------------------------- ndarray[M]          : Orthogonal distance of each initial point to the expected left lane marking\n\t<------------------------- ndarray[M]          : Orthogonal distance of each initial point to the expected right lane marking\n\t<------------------------- ndarray[M]          : Length of each curve from their initial point\n\t<------------------------- ndarray[M, M]       : Average distance between each pair of curves, in terms of expected lane widths\n\t<------------------------- ndarray[M, M]       : Average angle between each pair of curves, in radians\n\t";

 073: 	"""Compute the parameters given to the fuzzy systems from the discrete curves
 074: 	   - lines               : list<ndarray[2, N]> : Input discrete curves, in metric coordinates in the local road frame
 075: 	   - lane_width          : double              : Expected lane width, in meters
 076: 	   - main_angle          : double              : Expected angle of the lane relative to the vehicle, in radians
 077: 	   - main_angle_distance : double              : Distance at which that angle is reached
 078: 	   - angle_tolerance     : double              : Tolerance in radians around the main_angle for the initial point of each curve
 079: 	<------------------------- ndarray[M]          : Distance of the initial point of each curve to the vehicle
 080: 	<------------------------- ndarray[M]          : Orthogonal distance of each initial point to the expected left lane marking
 081: 	<------------------------- ndarray[M]          : Orthogonal distance of each initial point to the expected right lane marking
 082: 	<------------------------- ndarray[M]          : Length of each curve from their initial point
 083: 	<------------------------- ndarray[M, M]       : Average distance between each pair of curves, in terms of expected lane widths
 084: 	<------------------------- ndarray[M, M]       : Average angle between each pair of curves, in radians
 085: 	"""

 104: 	cdef double[:, :] line_view
 105: 	cdef double vector_x, vector_y, vector_angle
 106: 	cdef Py_ssize_t initial_index
 107: 
 108: 	# Precompute the expected markings
 109: 	# This is a bit complicated because assuming they are at `main_angle` straight ahead would completely disregard
 110: 	# the lateral offset and rotation of the vehicle relative to the lane
 111: 
 112: 	# So what we do here, is fitting a circle arc from the current vehicle position,
 113: 	# such that it reaches `main_angle` relative to the vehicle when y = main_angle_distance
 114: 	# This gives us a lateral offset for the expected lane center, that gets at [offset, main_angle_distance] instead of [0, main_angle_distance]
 115: 	# Then we get base points for the left and right markings by orthogonally offsetting this main point by a half lane width on each side 
 116: 	# From that, the expected markings are defined by those main points and the expected vector extracted from the main angle
 117: 	# This complicates things a bit, but given our far, far away visibility window, it is unavoidable
+118: 	cdef double[2] expected_vector = [cos(main_angle), sin(main_angle)]
  __pyx_t_10[0] = cos(__pyx_v_main_angle);
  __pyx_t_10[1] = sin(__pyx_v_main_angle);
  memcpy(&(__pyx_v_expected_vector[0]), __pyx_t_10, sizeof(__pyx_v_expected_vector[0]) * (2));

+119: 	cdef double[2] main_point = [0, main_angle_distance], left_main_point, right_main_point
  __pyx_t_11[0] = 0.0;
  __pyx_t_11[1] = __pyx_v_main_angle_distance;
  memcpy(&(__pyx_v_main_point[0]), __pyx_t_11, sizeof(__pyx_v_main_point[0]) * (2));

  if (__pyx_t_12) {

  }
